wordpressPost.title: Employee Appreciation Day 2016
wordpressPost.content:
This #EmployeeAppreciation day, a few reminders on your talent: i.e., the people you work with.

Of all the ways to keep people motivated and interested, none is easier than simply saying thank you. If you have a job, you work with people. You feel great when people appreciate you; today, take a minute to appreciate them! You’ll be satisfied about making the effort. It’s the right thing to do and it makes sound business sense: appreciated employees are more likely to be positive, engaged, high-performing, and have better retention rates.
Fortunately, WeSpire released a new white paper about Rewards & Recognition just last week, and you can download it here.
Highlights:

  • Honesty. A hollow thank you is probably worse than no thank you at all. So please, be thoughtful and sincere. Why do you want to commend this person? What is special about them?
  • Frequency. Regular people like to hear thank you’ more than once in a while. Millennials: even more often’but not so much that the appreciation feels bogus (see point 1).
  • Power of Peers. People love appreciation from the boss, of course, and peer recognition is also so meaningful.
  • Variety. Instead of appreciating a top employee with a gold watch or a stock email, dream up a fun outing, or let them organize it! Tie the experience to their favorite team, star, food, interest, or cause.

This #EmployeeAppreciation day and every day, the WeSpire team is here to help you properly appreciate the people you work with. We appreciate all of you! And, we intend to support you and your colleagues for your most important, meaningful work.
Please let us know if we can be helpful. And why not post a comment, as we’re eager to know what works best for you!
